explanation: The report is not correct. Rule 8.13 recommends using const-qualified pointee types when the pointed-to object is not modified through that pointer. In this function header_name and header_value are not only read: they are passed to MHD_add_response_entry_no_alloc_ (an API that, by its name and usage, likely takes ownership or expects a non-const pointer) and they are explicitly freed on error paths. Because the function takes ownership / deallocates the buffers (and interacts with APIs that take non-const pointers), it is not possible to const-qualify these parameters without changing the ownership semantics or introducing casts to discard const qualifiers (which MISRA forbids). Therefore it is appropriate that the parameters are declared as char * and MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is not violated in this context. If the API were intended only to view immutable data and never to free or transfer ownership, then const would be appropriate; but that is not the situation here.
